page.title: 02FARMING IN ILMINGTON
page.content: {Farming}in our area is mixed.This means that there are{dairy}and{arable} farms which sometimes even have sheep and pigs on them.Our farmers grow these{crops}: wheat,barley,oats and rape.The farmers start using{ {combine-harvesters}in July and this is the busiest time of the year for them.They make both square and round{ {bales}.{Silage}and hay are both made for winter cattle feed and root crops are grown too.Most of the{fields}have to be carefully drained because of numerous local springs.Most farmers do deep{ploughing}because of soil compaction caused by heavy{tractors. The use of artificial{fertilisers}has been one of the greatest changes in farming in recent years.{Cattle}are often put on sloping fields because they are difficult to plough.
